p: The IR spectrum of the HAp-B sample in Figure 3b, as well as the second derivative and the deconvoluted IR spectra from Figure 5, indicate only a few IR bands specific to basil EO in comparison with the bands specific to lavender EO. In [ 23, 26], it was shown that the basil and lavender EOs have many characteristic IR bands in the 800–1800 cm −1 spectral region. In the HAp-B IR spectrum, there were a few IR bands specific to the basil EO ( Table 2, Figure 3 and Figure 5). In the IR spectrum of HAp-L, more IR bands specific to lavender EO were identified ( Table 2, Figure 4 and Figure 6). This emphasizes the fact that the lavender EO was better adsorbed on the surface of hydroxyapatite compared to basil EO.
